STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 28, 2024
Lisa Marie Davis
IOSCO/ALCONA COUNTY DHHS
2145 E US 23,
EAST TAWAS, MI, 48730-9422
RE: License#: CP350201199
Dear Lisa Marie Davis:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/21/2024 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency interim evaluation was completed 10/3/2023. The areas of noncompliance
were Rule 413(c), 413(f)(i)(ii), and FOM 722-06B. The CAP for these areas of
noncompliance was approved 11/3/2023. This renewal evaluation did not identify
any areas of noncompliance.
The agency did not have any special investigations during this period related to
the agency's services.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The assessment included a
review of the areas identified in noncompliance, the barriers to establish
compliance, and the action steps taken as a part to the agency's corrective action
plan to establish and maintain compliance. It also included a review of the
agency's key performance indicators. The assessment indicated progress in
achieving the goals of the approved corrective action plan and additional proactive
efforts to maintain compliance.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert 1: Backyard has a hot tub and water requiring safety/rescue equipment.
Resolution 1: Latches were applied to lock the hot tub cover and safety/rescue
equipment was hung where it would be accessible.
Verification was provided by the agency including photos to confirm.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION

Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
8/23/2024
